C

check(Piece[][], Piece) - Static method in class chess.Chess
Checks if specified king is in check by any other opposite color piece
checkmate(Piece[][], Piece) - Static method in class chess.Chess
Checks whether the specified King is in checkmate
checkMove(Piece[][], int, int, int, int) - Method in class chess.Pawn
Method which checks if the pawn is moving one or two spaces forward If the pawn if moving 2 spaces forward, checks that the pawn is not jumping over anything Also checks that it is the first move of the pawn since that is the only time you can move two spaces
checkPawnPromotion(Piece[][], int, int, int, int) - Static method in class chess.Chess
Determines whether it is permissible for the pawn to be promoted Checks whether it has reached the opposite end and whether it is a pawn

M

main(String[]) - Static method in class chess.Chess
 
move(Piece[][], int, int, int, int) - Method in class chess.King
Implements the functionality of the king - one move in any direction Extends queen class which has same functionality as king but any number of moves Also takes care of castling
move(Piece[][], int, int, int, int) - Method in class chess.Knight
Implements functionality of the knight - makes sure does not kill same color
move(Piece[][], int, int, int, int) - Method in class chess.Pawn
Implements the move functionality of the Pawn Piece Takes care of killing diagonally - makes sure there is something to kill and that it is the opposite color Takes care of moving forward one or two spots by called checkMove method Takes care of enpassant by storing a piece which tracks which piece was moved last
move(Piece[][], int, int, int, int) - Method in class chess.Piece
Abstract method - each piece's move functionality is different but they all move Implement the move method differently in each piece
move(Piece[][], int, int, int, int) - Method in class chess.Queen
Implements the move functionality of the Queen - any number of spaces in any direction
moveDiagonally(Piece[][], int, int, int, int) - Method in class chess.Queen
Implements moving diagonal functionality of the queen which is also used for the bishop
moveDiagonally(Piece[][], int, int, int, int) - Method in class chess.Rook
Implements the functionality of the rook by extending the Queen class, which contains the same functionality Queen class also contains moving diagonally but the rook cannot do that, so return false
moveStraight(Piece[][], int, int, int, int) - Method in class chess.Bishop
Implements the move functionality of the bishop by extending the queen class which also contains the same functionality Return false if moveStraight because bishop cannot move straight even though queen can
moveStraight(Piece[][], int, int, int, int) - Method in class chess.Queen
Implements moving straight functionality of the queen which is also used for the rook
